Text:
Kagami rice cakes can be found at Great Ize Shrine,
the Therianthrope Shrine!
Great Ize Shrine... I've never heard of it.

Why is it that Zeta, another therianathrope, doesn't
know about it, but you do, Delta?

Zeta probably isn't interested. Recently, it's a
popular play area!
Play area? I thought a shrine would be a sacred spot.
Really? I don't get complicated stuff like that.

But I heard you can get a wonderful gift if you save
up your visitor points when you go to the shrine.

(It sounds like a theme park, but it IS a sacred
place, isn't it?)

They're supposed to give out kagami rice cakes at
the New Year's event!

I really don't understand what therianathropes are
thinking sometimes. I can't imagine anything
anymore...
Here we are!
This is...a sacred shrine, correct?
Yep!

There are balloons with characters on them...and
colorful but meaningless lights...

What exactly is sacred about this shrine? Is this not
entirely a theme park?

Don't look at me like that. I told you it was a play
place.

This questionable place looks as strange as I
expected. What a nightmare...

I don't know the complicated stuff, but this shrine's
actually got a thing called "history." Literal decades
of the stuff.
Back then, New Year events were supposed to be quiet―

Welcome! Try some Mitsugoshi sweet sake, made from
fermented rice!

Mitsugoshi? You there, do you have a moment? Does
this shrine have some connection with Mitsugoshi?

Yes! We wanted to revitalize our village and have fun
like therianthropes are supposed to...
Mitsugoshi supported our idea.
I see... So that's how it is.

(Through Mitsugoshi, the carefree and cheerful nature
of therianthropes has been combined with Shadow's
Shadow Wisdom.)

(A strange reaction between the two has led to the
birth of this unusual shrine...)

Come, come! Warm your innards with some super
spicy red kitsune udon noodles!

Try our green tanuki soba noodles heaped with veggies
to drive off any nasty bugs for a healthy new year!

*sniff, sniff*... Smells super good! And it looks so
tasty, I'm drooling!

They're selling it at those stalls over there.
I'm just gonna go over―
No you aren't.
Awoo... This kimono is tight and constricting...

It's good that I can easily use your kimono sash as
a leash.

Lady Alpha! Lady Alpha! They're selling sweet sake
over there! Can I drink some? Can I?

Just a moment. Excuse me, does this have alcohol
in it?
Of course not! Anyone can enjoy this deliciousness!

Oh, is that so... In that case, Delta, you may
have some.
Yay! *sniff, sniff*
Ahhhh! Warm, amazing, and not too sweet!
How about for you, milady?

Thank you for asking, but I'll pass. I'm afraid I
must refrain.

No worries, participants for the Great Ize-athlon
often refrain from drinking any so they can be
prepared for the main events.

The Great Ize-athlon...? Another term I've never
heard of...

It's three fun contests based on ascetic exercises,
passed down in the Great Ize Shrine.

The Great Ize-athlon rolls them into one, for everyone
to compete in.
Fun, I suppose...

Whoever clears the Great Ize-athlon with the best
results gets kagami rice cake.

Kagami rice cake! I didn't expect that information to
just fall into our laps.
Sounds fun! I wanna try the Great Ize-athlon!

Again, you immediately want to get involved... But I
suppose we should...

(We can get our hands on the kagami rice cake which
Cid had halfway given up on.)

(Between me and Delta, one of us will come out on top
and win the main prize.)

Alright, let's enter. It will be worth it just for
the prize.
Awoo! Great Ize-athlon!
You can sign up at the reception desk over there!

They will close to new entrants soon, so you'd better
hurry! Good luck!

My, oh my, I didn't think we'd be able to get kagami
rice cake so easily.

Let's try these contests and see what ascetic
exercises are like for therianathropes.
